text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jered,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteca.
The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who established himself as a mighty warrior on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pathrusites, Casluhites (from whom the Philistines descended) , and the Caphtorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan was the father of Sidon—his firstborn—and Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: as well as the Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arvadites, Zemarites, and Hamathites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.
The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two sons were born to Eber: the first was named Peleg, for during his lifetime the earth was divided; his brother’s name was Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abram (that is, Abraham).
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were their descendants:
Ishmael’s firstborn son was Nebaioth; the others were Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons to whom Keturah, Abraham’s concubine, gave birth: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, Shuah.
The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, and (by Timna) Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam. (Timna was Lotan’s sister.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Shobal: Alyan, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam.
The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Anah: Dishon.
The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, Jaakan.
The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king ruled over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor; the name of his city was Dinhabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah, succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad succeeded him. He struck down the Midianites in the plains of Moab; the name of his city was Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the River succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Shaul died, Baal Hanan son of Achbor succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Baal Hanan died, Hadad succeeded him; the name of his city was Pai. His wife was Mehetabel, daughter of Matred, daughter of Me-Zahab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hadad died.
The tribal chiefs of Edom were: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the tribal chiefs of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah; Issachar and Zebulun;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin;
Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bathshua, a Canaanite woman. Er, Judah’s firstborn, displeased the Lord, so the Lord killed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol, Dara—five in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Carmi: Achan, who brought the disaster on Israel when he stole what was devoted to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son of Ethan: Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons born to Hezron: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, the tribal chief of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nahshon was the father of Salma, and Salma was the father of Boaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesse was the father of Eliab, his firstborn; Abinadab was born second, Shimea third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel fourth, Raddai fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem sixth, and David seventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abshai, Joab, and Asahel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail bore Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb son of Hezron fathered sons by his wife Azubah (also known as Jerioth). Her sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later Hezron slept with the daughter of Makir, the father of Gilead. (He had married her when he was sixty years old.) She bore him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Segub was the father of Jair, who owned twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Geshur and Aram captured the towns of Jair, along with Kenath and its sixty surrounding towns.) All these were descendants of Makir, the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Hezron’s death, Caleb slept with Ephrath, his father Hezron’s widow, and she bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jerahmeel, Hezron’s firstborn, were Ram, the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah; she was Onam’s mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ram, Jerahmeel’s firstborn, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada.
The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishur’s wife was Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. (Seled died without having sons.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Appaim: Ishi.
The son of Ishi: Sheshan.
The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether and Jonathan. (Jether died without having sons.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza.
These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. Sheshan had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheshan gave his daughter to his servant Jarha as a wife; she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai was the father of Nathan, and Nathan was the father of Zabad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal was the father of Obed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed was the father of Jehu, and Jehu was the father of Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah was the father of Helez, and Helez was the father of Eleasah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleasah was the father of Sismai, and Sismai was the father of Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Caleb, Jerahmeel’s brother: His firstborn Mesha, the father of Ziph, and his second son Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shema was the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammai’s son was Maon, who was the father of Beth Zur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb’s concubine Ephah bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb’s concubine Maacah bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah and Sheva the father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the descendants of Caleb.
The sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrath: Shobal, the father of Kiriath Jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma, the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph, the father of Beth Gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shobal, the father of Kiriath Jearim, were Haroeh, half the Manahathites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the clans of Kiriath Jearim—the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. (The Zorathites and Eshtaolites descended from these groups.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the clans of the scribes who lived in Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who descended from Hammath, the father of Beth Rechab.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
the third was Absalom whose mother was Maacah, daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;
the fourth was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the fifth was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital;
the sixth was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah, David’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These six were born to David in Hebron, where he ruled for seven years and six months.
He ruled thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the sons born to him in Jerusalem:
Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—the mother of these four was Bathsheba the daughter of Ammiel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other nine were Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were all the sons of David, not counting the sons of his concubines. Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam,
followed by Abijah his son,
Asa his son,
Jehoshaphat his son,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joram his son,
Ahaziah his son,
Joash his son,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Amaziah his son,
Azariah his son,
Jotham his son,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ahaz his son,
Hezekiah his son,
Manasseh his son,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Amon his son,
Josiah his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Josiah: Johanan was the firstborn; Jehoiakim was born second; Zedekiah third; and Shallum fourth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehoiakim: his son Jehoiachin and his son Zedekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehoiachin the exile: Shealtiel his son,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei.
The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The five others were Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab Hesed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Hananiah: Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, of Arnan, of Obadiah, and of Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Shecaniah: Shemaiah and his sons: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—six in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam—three in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—seven in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reaiah the son of Shobal was the father of Jahath, and Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the clans of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. Their sister was Hazzelelponi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah and the father of Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Koz, who was the father of Anub, Hazzobebah, and the clans of Aharhel the son of Harum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez was more respected than his brothers. His mother had named him Jabez, for she said, “I experienced pain when I gave birth to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez called out to the God of Israel, “If only you would greatly bless me and expand my territory. May your hand be with me! Keep me from harm so I might not endure pain.” God answered his prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kelub, the brother of Shuhah, was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton was the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah, the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah.
The sons of Othniel: Hathath and Meonothai.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Meonothai was the father of Ophrah.
Seraiah was the father of Joab, the father of those who live in the Valley of the Craftsmen, for they were craftsmen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam.
The son of Elah: Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon.
Mered’s wife Bithiah gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, the father of Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: (His Judahite wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.) These were the sons of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithiah, whom Mered married.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham: the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben Hanan, and Tilon.
The descendants of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben Zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, the clans of the linen workers at Beth Ashbea,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokim, the men of Cozeba, and Joash and Saraph, both of whom ruled in Moab and Jashubi Lehem. (This information is from ancient records.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They were the potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah; they lived there and worked for the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Shallum, his son Mibsam, and his son Mishma.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Mishma: his son Hammuel, his son Zaccur, and his son Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters. But his brothers did not have many sons, so their whole clan was not as numerous as the sons of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Beer Sheba, Moladah, Hazar Shual,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and Shaaraim. These were their towns until the reign of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their settlements also included Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five towns,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with all their settlements that surrounded these towns as far as Baal. These were the places where they lived; they kept genealogical records.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their clan leaders were: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah (son of Seraiah, son of Asiel),
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleoenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziza son of Shipi (son of Allon, son of Jedaiah, son of Shimri, son of Shemaiah).
speaker: Narrator

text:
These who are named above were the leaders of their clans.
Their extended families increased greatly in numbers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, to the east of the valley, looking for pasture for their sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: They found fertile and rich pasture; the land was very broad, undisturbed and peaceful. Indeed some Hamites had been living there before that.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men whose names are listed came during the time of King Hezekiah of Judah and attacked the Hamites’ settlements, as well as the Meunites they discovered there, and they wiped them out, as can be seen to this very day. They dispossessed them, for they found pasture for their sheep there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five hundred men of Simeon, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, went to the hill country of Seir
speaker: Narrator

text: and defeated the rest of the Amalekite refugees; they live there to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn—
(Now he was the firstborn, but when he defiled his father’s bed, his rights as firstborn were given to the sons of Joseph, Israel’s son. So Reuben is not listed as firstborn in the genealogical records.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though Judah was the strongest among his brothers and a leader descended from him, the right of the firstborn belonged to Joseph.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Joel: his son Shemaiah, his son Gog, his son Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Micah, his son Reaiah, his son Baal,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his son Beerah, whom King Tiglath-Pileser of Assyria carried into exile. Beerah was the tribal leader of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His brothers by their clans, as listed in their genealogical records:
The leader Jeiel, Zechariah,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Bela son of Azaz, son of Shema, son of Joel.
They lived in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal Meon.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the east they settled as far as the entrance to the wilderness that stretches to the Euphrates River, for their cattle had increased in numbers in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the time of Saul they attacked the Hagrites and defeated them. They took over their territory in the entire eastern region of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad lived near them in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They included Joel the leader, Shapham the second in command, Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives, listed according to their families, included Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber—seven in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri, son of Jaroah, son of Gilead, son of Michael, son of Jeshishai, son of Jahdo, son of Buz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahi son of Abdiel, son of Guni, was the leader of the family.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its surrounding settlements, and in the pasturelands of Sharon to their very borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them were listed in the genealogical records in the time of King Jotham of Judah and in the time of King Jeroboam of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Reubenites, Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 men in their combined armies, warriors who carried shields and swords, were equipped with bows, and were trained for war.
speaker: Narrator

text: They attacked the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They received divine help in fighting them, and the Hagrites and all their allies were handed over to them. They cried out to God during the battle; he responded to their prayers because they trusted in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They seized the Hagrites’ animals, including 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, and 2,000 donkeys. They also took captive 100,000 people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because God fought for them, they killed many of the enemy. They dispossessed the Hagrites and lived in their land until the exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half-tribe of Manasseh settled in the land from Bashan as far as Baal Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon. They grew in number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the leaders of their families:
Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were skilled warriors, men of reputation, and leaders of their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and worshiped instead the gods of the native peoples whom God had destroyed before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel stirred up King Pul of Assyria (that is, King Tiglath-Pileser of Assyria), and he carried away the Reubenites, Gadites, and half-tribe of Manasseh and took them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan, where they remain to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: (5:27) The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.
The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas, and Phinehas was the father of Abishua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua was the father of Bukki, and Bukki was the father of Uzzi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth was the father of Amariah, and Amariah was the father of Ahitub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub was the father of Zadok, and Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah, and Azariah was the father of Johanan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan was the father of Azariah, who served as a priest in the temple Solomon built in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah was the father of Amariah, and Amariah was the father of Ahitub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub was the father of Zadok, and Zadok was the father of Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum was the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah was the father of Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah was the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehozadak went into exile when the Lord sent the people of Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
speaker: Narrator

text: (6:1) The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the sons Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.
These are the clans of the Levites by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Gershom: his son Libni, his son Jahath, his son Zimmah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Joah, his son Iddo, his son Zerah, and his son Jeatherai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath: his son Amminadab, his son Korah, his son Assir,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Elkanah, his son Ebiasaph, his son Assir,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Tahath, his son Uriel, his son Uzziah, and his son Shaul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai, Ahimoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Elkanah, his son Zophai, his son Nahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Eliab, his son Jeroham, and his son Elkanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Samuel: Joel the firstborn and Abijah the second oldest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Merari: Mahli, his son Libni, his son Shimei, his son Uzzah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Shimea, his son Haggiah, and his son Asaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men David put in charge of music in the Lord’s sanctuary, after the ark was placed there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They performed music before the sanctuary of the meeting tent until Solomon built the Lord’s temple in Jerusalem. They carried out their tasks according to regulations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the ones who served along with their sons:
From the Kohathites: Heman the musician, son of Joel, son of Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Elkanah, son of Jeroham, son of Eliel, son of Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Zuph, son of Elkanah, son of Mahath, son of Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Elkanah, son of Joel, son of Azariah, son of Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Tahath, son of Assir, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, son of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serving beside him was his fellow Levite Asaph, son of Berechiah, son of Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Michael, son of Baaseiah, son of Malkijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Ethni, son of Zerah, son of Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Ethan, son of Zimmah, son of Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Jahath, son of Gershom, son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Serving beside them were their fellow Levites, the descendants of Merari, led by Ethan, son of Kishi, son of Abdi, son of Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Hashabiah, son of Amaziah, son of Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Amzi, son of Bani, son of Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Mahli, son of Mushi, son of Merari, son of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of their fellow Levites were assigned to perform the remaining tasks at God’s sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Aaron and his descendants offered sacrifices on the altar for burnt offerings and on the altar for incense as they had been assigned to do in the Most Holy Sanctuary. They made atonement for Israel, just as God’s servant Moses had ordered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the descendants of Aaron:
His son Eleazar, his son Phinehas, his son Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Bukki, his son Uzzi, his son Zerahiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Meraioth, his son Amariah, his son Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Zadok, and his son Ahimaaz.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were the areas where Aaron’s descendants lived:
The following belonged to the Kohathite clan, for they received the first allotment:
speaker: Narrator

text: They were allotted Hebron in the territory of Judah, as well as its surrounding pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But the city’s land and nearby towns were allotted to Caleb son of Jephunneh.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Aaron were also allotted as cities of refuge Hebron, Libnah and its pasturelands, Jattir, Eshtemoa and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilez and its pasturelands, Debir and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan and its pasturelands, and Beth Shemesh and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Benjamin they were allotted Geba and its pasturelands, Alemeth and its pasturelands, and Anathoth and its pasturelands. Their clans were allotted thirteen cities in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten cities in the territory of the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of Gershom’s descendants received thirteen cities within the territory of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh (in Bashan).
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of Merari’s descendants were allotted twelve cities within the territory of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites gave to the Levites these cities and their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: They allotted these previously named cities from the territory of the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of Kohath’s descendants also received cities as their territory within the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were allotted as cities of refuge Shechem and its pasturelands (in the hill country of Ephraim), Gezer and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam and its pasturelands, Beth Horon and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon and its pasturelands, and Gath Rimmon and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the half-tribe of Manasseh, the rest of Kohath’s descendants received Aner and its pasturelands and Bileam and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The following belonged to Gershom’s descendants:
Within the territory of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan and its pasturelands and Ashtaroth and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh and its pasturelands, Daberath and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ramoth and its pasturelands, and Anem and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Asher: Mashal and its pasturelands, Abdon and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok and its pasturelands, and Rehob and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee and its pasturelands, Hammon and its pasturelands, and Kiriathaim and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The following belonged to the rest of Merari’s descendants:
Within the territory of the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono and its pasturelands, and Tabor and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Reuben across the Jordan River east of Jericho: Bezer in the wilderness and its pasturelands, Jahzah and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth and its pasturelands, and Mephaath and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within the territory of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead and its pasturelands, Mahanaim and its pasturelands,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon and its pasturelands, and Jazer and its pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Samuel. They were leaders of their families. In the time of David there were 22,600 warriors listed in Tola’s genealogical records.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Uzzi: Izrahiah.
The sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. All five were leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the genealogical records of their families, they had 36,000 warriors available for battle, for they had numerous wives and sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Altogether the genealogical records of the clans of Issachar listed 87,000 warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker, and Jediael—three in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. The five of them were leaders of their families. There were 22,034 warriors listed in their genealogical records.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beker: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Beker.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were 20,200 family leaders and warriors listed in their genealogical records.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Jediael: Bilhan.
The sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the sons of Jediael. There were 17,200 family leaders and warriors who were capable of marching out to battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Shuppites and Huppites were descendants of Ir; the Hushites were descendants of Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum—sons of Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, who was born to Manasseh’s Aramean concubine. She also gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now Makir married a wife from the Huppites and Shuppites. (His sister’s name was Maacah.)
Zelophehad was Manasseh’s second son; he had only daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah, Makir’s wife, gave birth to a son, whom she named Peresh. His brother was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rekem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Ulam: Bedan.
These were the sons of Gilead, son of Makir, son of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sister Hammoleketh gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Ephraim: Shuthelah, his son Bered, his son Tahath, his son Eleadah, his son Tahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Zabad, his son Shuthelah (Ezer and Elead were killed by the men of Gath, who were natives of the land, when they went down to steal their cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their father Ephraim mourned for them many days and his brothers came to console him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He slept with his wife; she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. Ephraim named him Beriah because tragedy had come to his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter was Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon, as well as Uzzen Sheerah),
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Rephah, his son Resheph, his son Telah, his son Tahan,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Ladan, his son Ammihud, his son Elishama,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Nun, and his son Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their property and settlements included Bethel and its surrounding towns, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its surrounding towns to the west, and Shechem and its surrounding towns as far as Ayyah and its surrounding towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the border of Manasseh’s territory were Beth Shean and its surrounding towns, Taanach and its surrounding towns, Megiddo and its surrounding towns, and Dor and its surrounding towns. The descendants of Joseph, Israel’s son, lived here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Serah was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malkiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and Shua their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were Japhlet’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Shemer: Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Helem: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were the descendants of Asher. They were the leaders of their families, the most capable men, who were warriors and served as head chiefs. There were 26,000 warriors listed in their genealogical records as capable of doing battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin was the father of Bela, his firstborn; Ashbel was born second, Aharah third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah fourth, and Rapha fifth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela’s sons were Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the descendants of Ehud who were leaders of the families living in Geba who were forced to move to Manahath:
speaker: Narrator

text: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, who moved them. Gera was the father of Uzzah and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaharaim fathered sons in Moab after he divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
speaker: Narrator

text: By his wife Hodesh he fathered Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. These were his sons; they were family leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: By Hushim he fathered Abitub and Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod, as well as its surrounding towns),
speaker: Narrator

text: Beriah, and Shema. They were leaders of the families living in Aijalon and chased out the inhabitants of Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
speaker: Narrator

text: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shamsherai, Shechariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zikri were the sons of Jeroham.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the family leaders listed in the genealogical records; they lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon; his wife’s name was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zeker, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeah. They also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner was the father of Kish, and Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Jonathan: Meribbaal.
Meribbaal was the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah, and Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moza was the father of Binea. His son was Raphah, whose son was Eleasah, whose son was Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons: Azrikam his firstborn, followed by Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of his brother Eshek:
Ulam was his firstborn, Jeush second, and Eliphelet third.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Ulam were warriors who were adept archers. They had many sons and grandsons, a total of 150.
All these were the descendants of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Genealogical records were kept for all Israel; they are recorded in the Scroll of the Kings of Israel.
The people of Judah were carried away to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first to resettle on their property and in their cities were some Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some from the tribes of Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim and Manasseh settled in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The settlers included: Uthai son of Ammihud, son of Omri, son of Imri, son of Bani, who was a descendant of Perez son of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the descendants of Zerah: Jeuel.
Their relatives numbered 690.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the descendants of Benjamin:
Sallu son of Meshullam, son of Hodaviah, son of Hassenuah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, son of Mikri; and Meshullam son of Shephatiah, son of Reuel, son of Ibnijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives, listed in their genealogical records, numbered 956. All these men were leaders of their families.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the priests:
Jedaiah; Jehoiarib; Jakin;
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah son of Hilkiah, son of Meshullam, son of Zadok, son of Meraioth, son of Ahitub the leader in God’s temple;
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah son of Jeroham, son of Pashhur, son of Malkijah; and Maasai son of Adiel, son of Jahzerah, son of Meshullam, son of Meshillemith, son of Immer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives, who were leaders of their families, numbered 1,760. They were capable men who were assigned to carry out the various tasks of service in God’s temple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the Levites:
Shemaiah son of Hasshub, son of Azrikam, son of Hashabiah a descendant of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: Bakbakkar; Heresh; Galal; Mattaniah son of Mika, son of Zikri, son of Asaph;
speaker: Narrator

text: Obadiah son of Shemaiah, son of Galal, son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah son of Asa, son of Elkanah, who lived among the settlements of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The gatekeepers were:
Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brothers. Shallum was the leader;
speaker: Narrator

text: he serves to this day at the King’s Gate on the east. These were the gatekeepers from the camp of the descendants of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum son of Kore, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah, and his relatives from his family (the Korahites) were assigned to guard the entrance to the sanctuary. Their ancestors had guarded the entrance to the Lord’s dwelling place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Phinehas son of Eleazar had been their leader in earlier times, and the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the guard at the entrance to the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those selected to be gatekeepers at the entrances numbered 212. Their names were recorded in the genealogical records of their settlements. David and Samuel the prophet had appointed them to their positions.
speaker: Narrator

text: They and their descendants were assigned to guard the gates of the Lord’s sanctuary (that is, the tabernacle).
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers were posted on all four sides—east, west, north, and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives, who lived in their settlements, came from time to time and served with them for seven-day periods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The four head gatekeepers, who were Levites, were assigned to guard the storerooms and treasuries in God’s sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: They would spend the night in their posts all around God’s sanctuary, for they were assigned to guard it and would open it with the key every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them were in charge of the articles used by those who served; they counted them when they brought them in and when they brought them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them were in charge of the equipment and articles of the sanctuary, as well as the flour, wine, olive oil, incense, and spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But some of the priests mixed the spices.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, a Levite, the firstborn son of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of baking the bread for offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Kohathites, their relatives, were in charge of preparing the bread that is displayed each Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The musicians and Levite family leaders stayed in rooms at the sanctuary and were exempt from other duties, for day and night they had to carry out their assigned tasks.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the family leaders of the Levites, as listed in their genealogical records. They lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel (the father of Gibeon) lived in Gibeon. His wife was Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner was the father of Kish, and Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The son of Jonathan:
Meribbaal, who was the father of Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Micah:
Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz was the father of Jarah, and Jarah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Moza was the father of Binea. His son was Rephaiah, whose son was Eleasah, whose son was Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons: Azrikam his firstborn, followed by Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines fought against Israel. The Israelites fled before the Philistines and many of them fell dead on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines stayed right on the heels of Saul and his sons. They struck down Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malki-Shua.
speaker: Narrator

text: The battle was thick around Saul; the archers spotted him and wounded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul told his armor-bearer, “Draw your sword and stab me with it. Otherwise these uncircumcised people will come and torture me.” But his armor-bearer refused to do it, because he was very afraid. So Saul took the sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul and his three sons died; his whole household died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the Israelites who were in the valley saw that the army had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled. The Philistines came and occupied them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day, when the Philistines came to strip loot from the corpses, they discovered Saul and his sons lying dead on Mount Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped his corpse, and then carried off his head and his armor. They sent messengers throughout the land of the Philistines proclaiming the news to their idols and their people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They placed his armor in the temple of their gods and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the residents of Jabesh Gilead heard about everything the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: all the warriors went and recovered the bodies of Saul and his sons and brought them to Jabesh. They buried their remains under the oak tree in Jabesh and fasted for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died because he was unfaithful to the Lord and did not obey the Lord’s instructions; he even tried to conjure up underworld spirits.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not seek the Lord’s guidance, so the Lord killed him and transferred the kingdom to David son of Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel joined David at Hebron and said, “Look, we are your very flesh and blood!
speaker: Narrator

text: In the past, even when Saul was king, you were Israel’s commanding general. The Lord your God said to you, ‘You will shepherd my people Israel; you will rule over my people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the leaders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord. They anointed David king over Israel, in keeping with the Lord’s message that came through Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and the whole Israelite army advanced to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). (The Jebusites, the land’s original inhabitants, lived there.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The residents of Jebus said to David, “You cannot invade this place!” But David captured the fortress of Zion (that is, the City of David).
speaker: Narrator

text: David said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will become commanding general!” So Joab son of Zeruiah attacked first and became commander.
speaker: Narrator

text: David lived in the fortress; for this reason it is called the City of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built up the city around it, from the terrace to the surrounding walls; Joab restored the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: David’s power steadily grew, for the Lord of Heaven’s Armies was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the leaders of David’s warriors who, together with all Israel, stood courageously with him in his kingdom by installing him as king, in keeping with the Lord’s message concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the list of David’s warriors:
Jashobeam, a Hacmonite, was head of the officers. He killed 300 men with his spear in a single battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next in command was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite. He was one of the three elite warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David in Pas Dammim when the Philistines assembled there for battle. In an area of the field that was full of barley, the army retreated before the Philistines,
speaker: Narrator

text: but then they made a stand in the middle of that area. They defended it and defeated the Philistines; the Lord gave them a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three of the thirty leaders went down to David at the rocky cliff at the cave of Adullam, while a Philistine force was camped in the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was in the stronghold at the time, while a Philistine garrison was in Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was thirsty and said, “How I wish someone would give me some water to drink from the cistern in Bethlehem near the city gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the three elite warriors broke through the Philistine forces and drew some water from the cistern in Bethlehem near the city gate. They carried it back to David, but David refused to drink it. He poured it out as a drink offering to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “God forbid that I should do this! Should I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?” Because they risked their lives to bring it to him, he refused to drink it. Such were the exploits of the three elite warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishai the brother of Joab was head of the three elite warriors. He killed 300 men with his spear and gained fame along with the three elite warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the three he was given double honor and he became their officer, even though he was not one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a brave warrior from Kabzeel who performed great exploits. He struck down the two sons of Ariel of Moab; he also went down and killed a lion inside a cistern on a snowy day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He even killed an Egyptian who was 7½ feet tall. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand as big as the crossbeam of a weaver’s loom; Benaiah attacked him with a club. He grabbed the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who gained fame along with the three elite warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: He received honor from the thirty warriors, though he was not one of the three elite warriors. David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mighty warriors were:
Asahel the brother of Joab,
Elhanan son of Dodo, from Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shammoth the Harorite,
Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
Abiezer the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sibbekai the Hushathite,
Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Maharai the Netophathite,
Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjaminite territory,
Benaiah the Pirathonite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hurai from the valleys of Gaash,
Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Azmaveth the Baharumite,
Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the sons of Hashem the Gizonite,
Jonathan son of Shageh the Hararite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ahiam son of Sakar the Hararite,
Eliphal son of Ur,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hepher the Mekerathite,
Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hezro the Carmelite,
Naarai son of Ezbai,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Joel the brother of Nathan,
Mibhar son of Hagri,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zelek the Ammonite,
Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ira the Ithrite,
Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uriah the Hittite,
Zabad son of Achli,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, leader of the Reubenites and the thirty warriors with him,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hanan son of Maacah,
Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uzzia the Ashterathite,
Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jediael son of Shimri,
and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Eliel the Mahavite,
and Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam,
and Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Eliel,
and Obed,
and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the men who joined David in Ziklag, when he was banished from the presence of Saul son of Kish. (They were among the warriors who assisted him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were armed with bows and could shoot arrows or sling stones right or left-handed. They were fellow tribesmen of Saul from Benjamin.) These were:
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahiezer, the leader, and Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; Berachah, Jehu the Anathothite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, one of the thirty warriors and their leader, (12:5) Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: (12:6) Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, who were Korahites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Gadites joined David at the stronghold in the wilderness. They were warriors who were trained for battle; they carried shields and spears. They were as fierce as lions and could run as quickly as gazelles across the hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ezer was the leader, Obadiah the second in command, Eliab the third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah the tenth, and Machbannai the eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These Gadites were military leaders; the least led a hundred men, the greatest a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: They crossed the Jordan River in the first month, when it was overflowing its banks, and routed those living in all the valleys to the east and west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some from Benjamin and Judah also came to David’s stronghold.
speaker: Narrator

text: David went out to meet them and said, “If you come to me in peace and want to help me, then I will make an alliance with you. But if you come to betray me to my enemies when I have not harmed you, may the God of our ancestors take notice and judge!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But a spirit empowered Amasai, the leader of the group of warriors known as the Thirty, and he said:
“We are yours, O David!
We support you, O son of Jesse!
May you greatly prosper.
May those who help you prosper.
Indeed your God helps you!”
So David accepted them and made them leaders of raiding bands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men from Manasseh joined David when he went with the Philistines to fight against Saul. (But in the end they did not help the Philistines because, after taking counsel, the Philistine lords sent David away, saying, “It would be disastrous for us if he deserts to his master Saul.”)
speaker: Narrator

text: When David went to Ziklag, the men of Manasseh who joined him were Adnach, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, leaders of 1,000 soldiers each in the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David fight against raiding bands, for all of them were warriors and leaders in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each day men came to help David until his army became very large.
speaker: Narrator

text: The following is a record of the armed warriors who came with their leaders and joined David in Hebron in order to make David king in Saul’s place, in accordance with the Lord’s decree:
speaker: Narrator

text: From Judah came 6,800 trained warriors carrying shields and spears.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Simeon there were 7,100 warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Levi there were 4,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada, the leader of Aaron’s descendants, brought 3,700 men with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with Zadok, a young warrior, and 22 leaders from his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Benjamin, Saul’s tribe, there were 3,000, most of whom, up to that time, had been loyal to Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Ephraim there were 20,800 warriors, who had brought fame to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh there were 18,000 who had been designated by name to come and make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Issachar there were 200 leaders and all their relatives at their command—they understood the times and knew what Israel should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Zebulun there were 50,000 warriors who were prepared for battle, equipped with all kinds of weapons, and ready to give their undivided loyalty.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Naphtali there were 1,000 officers, along with 37,000 men carrying shields and spears.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Dan there were 28,600 men prepared for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Asher there were 40,000 warriors prepared for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the other side of the Jordan, from Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, there were 120,000 men armed with all kinds of weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these men were warriors who were ready to march. They came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel by acclamation; all the rest of the Israelites also were in agreement that David should become king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spent three days feasting there with David, for their relatives had given them provisions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also their neighbors, from as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, were bringing food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen. There were large supplies of flour, fig cakes, raisins, wine, olive oil, beef, and lamb, for Israel was celebrating.
speaker: Narrator

text: David consulted with his military officers, including those who led groups of a thousand and those who led groups of a hundred.
speaker: Narrator

text: David said to the whole Israelite assembly, “If you so desire and the Lord our God approves, let’s spread the word to our brothers who remain in all the regions of Israel, and to the priests and Levites in their cities, so they may join us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let’s move the ark of our God back here, for we did not seek his will throughout Saul’s reign.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole assembly agreed to do this, for the proposal seemed right to all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all Israel from the Shihor River in Egypt to Lebo Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all Israel went up to Baalah (that is, Kiriath Jearim) in Judah to bring up from there the ark of God the Lord, who sits enthroned between the cherubim—the ark that is called by his Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They transported the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab; Uzzah and Ahio were guiding the cart,
speaker: Narrator

text: while David and all Israel were energetically celebrating before God, singing and playing various stringed instruments, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrived at the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah reached out his hand to take hold of the ark, because the oxen stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord was so furious with Uzzah, he killed him, because he reached out his hand and touched the ark. He died right there before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was angry because the Lord attacked Uzzah; so he called that place Perez Uzzah, which remains its name to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was afraid of God that day and said, “How will I ever be able to bring the ark of God up here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David did not move the ark to the City of David; he left it in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ark of God remained in Obed-Edom’s house for three months; the Lord blessed Obed-Edom’s family and everything that belonged to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: King Hiram of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: David realized that the Lord had established him as king over Israel and that he had elevated his kingdom for the sake of his people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Jerusalem David married more wives and fathered more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king of all Israel, all the Philistines marched up to confront him. When David heard about it, he marched out against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Philistines had come and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David asked God, “Should I march up against the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?” The Lord said to him, “March up! I will hand them over to you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they marched against Baal Perazim and David defeated them there. David said, “Using me as his instrument, God has burst out against my enemies like water bursts out.” So that place is called Baal Perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines left their idols there, so David ordered that they be burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines again raided the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David again asked God what he should do. This time God told him, “Don’t march up after them; circle around them and come against them in front of the trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the trees, then attack. For at that moment God is going before you to strike down the army of the Philistines.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David did just as God commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David became famous in all the lands; the Lord caused all the nations to fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: David constructed buildings in the City of David; he then prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David said, “Only the Levites may carry the ark of God, for the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to serve before him perpetually.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem to bring the ark of the Lord up to the place he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David gathered together the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Kohath: Uriel the leader and 120 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Merari: Asaiah the leader and 220 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Gershom: Joel the leader and 130 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the leader and 200 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Hebron: Eliel the leader and 80 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Uzziel: Amminadab the leader and 112 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar, along with the Levites Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them: “You are the leaders of the Levites’ families. You and your relatives must consecrate yourselves and bring the ark of the Lord God of Israel up to the place I have prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first time you did not carry it; that is why the Lord God attacked us, because we did not ask him about the proper way to carry it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests and Levites consecrated themselves so they could bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Levi carried the ark of God on their shoulders with poles, just as Moses had commanded in keeping with the Lord’s instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: David told the leaders of the Levites to appoint some of their relatives as musicians; they were to play various instruments, including stringed instruments and cymbals, and to sing loudly and joyfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Levites appointed Heman son of Joel; one of his relatives, Asaph son of Berechiah; one of the descendants of Merari, Ethan son of Kushaiah;
speaker: Narrator

text: along with some of their relatives who were second in rank, including Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The musicians Heman, Asaph, and Ethan were to sound the bronze cymbals;
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to play the harps according to the alamoth style;
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to play the lyres according to the sheminith style, as led by the director;
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenaniah, the leader of the Levites, was in charge of transport, for he was well-informed on this matter;
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah were guardians of the ark;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests were to blow the trumpets before the ark of God; Obed-Edom and Jehiel were also guardians of the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David, the leaders of Israel, and the commanders of units of a thousand went to bring up the ark of the Lord’s covenant from the house of Obed-Edom with celebration.
speaker: Narrator

text: When God helped the Levites who were carrying the ark of the Lord’s covenant, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was wrapped in a linen robe, as were all the Levites carrying the ark, the musicians, and Kenaniah the supervisor of transport and the musicians; David also wore a linen ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel brought up the ark of the Lord’s covenant; they were shouting, blowing trumpets, sounding cymbals, and playing stringed instruments.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the ark of the Lord’s covenant entered the City of David, Michal, Saul’s daughter, looked out the window. When she saw King David jumping and celebrating, she despised him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the ark of God and put it in the middle of the tent David had pitched for it. Then they offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David finished offering burnt sacrifices and peace offerings, he pronounced a blessing over the people in the Lord’s name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He then handed out to each Israelite man and woman a loaf of bread, a date cake, and a raisin cake.
speaker: Narrator

text: He appointed some of the Levites to serve before the ark of the Lord, to offer prayers, songs of thanks, and hymns to the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asaph was the leader and Zechariah second-in-command, followed by Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel. They were to play stringed instruments, Asaph was to sound the cymbals,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the priests Benaiah and Jahaziel were to blow trumpets regularly before the ark of God’s covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: That day David first gave to Asaph and his colleagues this song of thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord!
Call on his name!
Make known his accomplishments among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him! Make music to him!
Tell about all his miraculous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Boast about his holy name.
Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and the strength he gives.
Seek his presence continually!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Recall the miraculous deeds he performed,
his mighty acts and the judgments he decreed,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O children of Israel, God’s servant,
you descendants of Jacob, God’s chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
he carries out judgment throughout the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember continually his covenantal decree,
the promise he made to a thousand generations—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the promise he made to Abraham,
the promise he made by oath to Isaac!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave it to Jacob as a decree,
to Israel as a lasting promise,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
as the portion of your inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were few in number,
just a very few, and foreign residents within it,
speaker: Narrator

text:
they wandered from nation to nation,
and from one kingdom to another.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He let no one oppress them;
he disciplined kings for their sake,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying, “Don’t touch my anointed ones!
Don’t harm my prophets!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth!
Announce every day how he delivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell the nations about his splendor,
tell all the nations about his miraculous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is great and certainly worthy of praise,
he is more awesome than all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all the gods of the nations are worthless,
but the Lord made the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Majestic splendor emanates from him,
he is the source of strength and joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the nations,
ascribe to the Lord splendor and strength!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord the splendor he deserves!
Bring an offering and enter his presence!
Worship the Lord in holy attire!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble before him, all the earth!
The world is established, it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens rejoice, and the earth be happy!
Let the nations say, “The Lord reigns!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea and everything in it shout!
Let the fields and everything in them celebrate!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then let the trees of the forest shout with joy before the Lord,
for he comes to judge the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good
and his loyal love endures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say this prayer: “Deliver us, O God who delivers us!
Gather us! Rescue us from the nations!
Then we will give thanks to your holy name,
and boast about your praiseworthy deeds.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord God of Israel be praised,
in the future and forevermore.
Then all the people said, “We agree! Praise the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: David left Asaph and his colleagues there before the ark of the Lord’s covenant to serve before the ark regularly and fulfill each day’s requirements,
speaker: Narrator

text: including Obed-Edom and sixty-eight colleagues. Obed-Edom son of Jeduthun and Hosah were gatekeepers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok the priest and his fellow priests served before the Lord’s tabernacle at the worship center in Gibeon,
speaker: Narrator

text: regularly offering burnt sacrifices to the Lord on the altar for burnt sacrifice, morning and evening, according to what is prescribed in the law of the Lord which he charged Israel to observe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joining them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest of those chosen and designated by name to give thanks to the Lord. (For his loyal love endures!)
speaker: Narrator

text: Heman and Jeduthun were in charge of the music, including the trumpets, cymbals, and the other musical instruments used in praising God. The sons of Jeduthun guarded the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people returned to their homes, and David went to pronounce a blessing on his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David had settled into his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Look, I am living in a palace made from cedar, while the ark of the Lord’s covenant is under a tent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathan said to David, “You should do whatever you have in mind, for God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That night God told Nathan,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go, tell my servant David: ‘This is what the Lord says: “You must not build me a house in which to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have not lived in a house from the time I brought Israel up from Egypt to the present day. I have lived in a tent that has been in various places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever I moved throughout Israel, I did not say to any of the leaders whom I appointed to care for my people Israel, ‘Why have you not built me a house made from cedar?’”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “So now, say this to my servant David: ‘This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies says: “I took you from the pasture and from your work as a shepherd to make you a leader of my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was with you wherever you went and I defeated all your enemies before you. Now I will make you as famous as the great men of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will establish a place for my people Israel and settle them there; they will live there and not be disturbed anymore. Violent men will not oppress them again, as they did in the beginning
speaker: Narrator

text:
and during the time when I appointed judges to lead my people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies.
“‘“I declare to you that the Lord will build a dynastic house for you!
speaker: Narrator

text: When the time comes for you to die, I will raise up your descendant, one of your own sons, to succeed you, and I will establish his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will build me a house, and I will make his dynasty permanent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will become his father and he will become my son. I will never withhold my loyal love from him, as I withheld it from the one who ruled before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will put him in permanent charge of my house and my kingdom; his dynasty will be permanent.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathan told David all these words that were revealed to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: King David went in, sat before the Lord, and said: “Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my family, that you should have brought me to this point?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you did not stop there, O God! You have also spoken about the future of your servant’s family. You have revealed to me what men long to know, O Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: What more can David say to you? You have honored your servant; you have given your servant special recognition.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, for the sake of your servant and according to your will, you have done this great thing in order to reveal your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Lord, there is none like you; there is no God besides you! What we heard is true!
speaker: Narrator

text: And who is like your people, Israel, a unique nation in the earth? Their God went to claim a nation for himself! You made a name for yourself by doing great and awesome deeds when you drove out nations before your people whom you had delivered from the Egyptian empire and its gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: You made Israel your very own nation for all time. You, O Lord, became their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, O Lord, may the promise you made about your servant and his family become a permanent reality! Do as you promised,
speaker: Narrator

text: so it may become a reality and you may gain lasting fame, as people say, ‘The Lord of Heaven’s Armies is the God of Israel.’ The dynasty of your servant David will be established before you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build a dynasty for him. That is why your servant has had the courage to pray to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, O Lord, you are the true God; you have made this good promise to your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you are willing to bless your servant’s dynasty so that it may stand permanently before you, for you, O Lord, have blessed it and it will be blessed from now on into the future.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Later David defeated the Philistines and subdued them. He took Gath and its surrounding towns away from the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: He defeated the Moabites; the Moabites became David’s subjects and brought tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: David defeated King Hadadezer of Zobah as far as Hamath, when he went to extend his authority to the Euphrates River.
speaker: Narrator

text: David seized from him 1,000 chariots, 7,000 charioteers, and 20,000 infantrymen . David cut the hamstrings of all but 100 of Hadadezer’s chariot horses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Arameans of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah, but David killed 22,000 of the Arameans.
speaker: Narrator

text: David placed garrisons in the territory of the Arameans of Damascus; the Arameans became David’s subjects and brought tribute. The Lord protected David wherever he campaigned.
speaker: Narrator
